body_html:

Out[5]: '0.1.12+08bb3b7'

In [1]: x = torch.randn(10, 10, 10).cuda()
In [2]: idx = torch.LongTensor([1,2,3])
In [3]: x[:, idx, :];
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-cb39cd34d586> in <module>()
----> 1 x[:, idx, :];

TypeError: indexing a tensor with an object of type torch.LongTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars and torch.cuda.LongTensor or torch.cuda.ByteTensor as the only argument.

body:
It does not seem so. Maybe my version is too old ?

```python
In [4]: torch.__version__
Out[5]: '0.1.12+08bb3b7'

In [1]: x = torch.randn(10, 10, 10).cuda()
In [2]: idx = torch.LongTensor([1,2,3])
In [3]: x[:, idx, :];
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-cb39cd34d586> in <module>()
----> 1 x[:, idx, :];

TypeError: indexing a tensor with an object of type torch.LongTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars and torch.cuda.LongTensor or torch.cuda.ByteTensor as the only argument.
```
